intro: Dimorphostemon glandulosus, commonly known as the glandular dimorphostemon, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine glandular hairs. Its flowers are typically small, clustered in cymes, and display a range of colors from white to pink. Dimorphostemon glandulosus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
